title: 113_hr2273
content: The Act may be cited as the "Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013" and includes definitions for key terms. The Act, known as the "Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013," defines terms like "Great Lakes" and "Great Lakes Navigational System," including specific lakes, connecting waters, federal responsibilities, and commercial navigation areas. It also defines "eligible operations and maintenance." The "Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013" defines terms like "Great Lakes" and "Great Lakes Navigational System," including specific lakes, connecting waters, federal responsibilities, and commercial navigation areas. "Eligible operations and maintenance" is defined as in section 214 of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986 (33 U.S.C. 2241), and the "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Army. SEC. 3 of the "Great Lakes Navigation System Sustainability Act of 2013" mandates the efficient management and funding allocation for all navigation projects in the Great Lakes as a single system. Cargo measurements are aggregated for budget prioritization. The Secretary will establish a program to fund maintenance projects of the Great Lakes Navigation System, consulting with Congressional delegations for funding priorities. $200,000,000 is authorized for appropriations from the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund annually until 2023. The Secretary will prioritize projects with non-Federal sponsors providing a 50% cost share for eligible operations and maintenance expenses in the Great Lakes Navigation System. Certain Great Lakes Navigation System projects are eligible for Federal operations and maintenance funds if they meet specific criteria, including a 50% cost share from the non-Federal sponsor. Certain Great Lakes Navigation System projects that meet specific criteria, and where the non-Federal sponsor does not provide a 50% cost share, can receive Federal operations and maintenance funds.
